abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment (EA) aims
            at minimizing negative environmental impacts, as a result of
            the Fortaleza Urban Transport Project, which include
            construction of access roads, transport corridors, as well
            as traffic management. However, the report specifically
            addresses the potential impacts resulting from the
            construction of the underground subway western line, under
            the responsibility of Metrofor (Companhia Cearense de
            Transportes Metropolitanos). It comprises six volumes, i.e.,
            the environmental procedures manual for civil works, the
            environmental management plan, and annex, studies on urban
            impacts, progress report, and implementation guidelines.
            During construction, noise, dust, and light pollution,
            vibration, and traffic disruption will occur. In addition,
            spoil arising from excavation will need to be disposed, or
            reused. Mitigating measures assume: water effluents, and
            sludge should be treated according to environmental
            regulations, and, waste disposal collected by the municipal
            collector agency (EMLURB); provisions regarding safety, call
            for adequate traffic signaling, and traffic safety measures,
            and includes the installation of protective barriers; noise
            abatement measures include construction of sound barriers,
            and work schedules to be limited to daytime only;
            landscaping, and vegetation will be actively restored; and,
            consultation with the community will be pursued.
